properties.areaDesc: Bayside and Gulf side from Craig Key to West End of Seven Mile Bridge; Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to south of Halfmoon Shoal out 20 NM; Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas out 20 NM; Gulf of Mexico from West End of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5 Fathoms; Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to south of Halfmoon Shoal 20 to 60 NM out; Gulf waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 NM out and beyond 5 fathoms; Gulf of Mexico including Dry Tortugas and Rebecca Shoal Channel; Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas 20 to 60 NM out; Hawk Channel from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to the reef
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued January 31 at 9:34PM EST until January 31 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Key West FL
properties.description:
For the following areas...
Hawk Channel and Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile
Bridge to 20 nm west of Dry Tortugas out 60 nm...
Bay and Gulf Side from Craig Key to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5
fathoms...
Gulf of Mexico including Dry Tortugas and Rebecca Shoal Channel...
Gulf Waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 nm out and
beyond 5 fathoms...

At 934 PM EST, severe thunderstorms with possible waterspouts were
located along a line extending from 14 nm south of D Tower to 13 nm
northwest of Content Keys to Snipe Point to Western Dry Rocks to 13
nm south of Twenty-Eight Foot Shoal Light, moving east at 35 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts in excess of 50 knots.

SOURCE...National Weather Service Meteorologist.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats, cause
considerable damage to vessels and create suddenly higher
waves. Expect wind gusts in excess of 50 knots and suddenly
higher waves, boats could sustain significant damage or
capsize.

Locations in the warning include...
Annette Key, Vandenberg, Halfmoon Shoal Light, Blacklion Bay, Howe
Key, East Sambo and Snipe Point.
properties.instruction:
Return to port now if possible. Otherwise, prepare for severe
thunderstorms with wind gusts in excess of 50 knots, extremely rough
seas, frequent lightning, and torrential downpours. Be advised that
any severe thunderstorm can spawn a waterspout or tornado.

Intense and continuous lightning is occurring with these storms. If
caught on the open water, stay low or go below.

NWSheadline: A SPECIAL MARINE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EST
